subject: Home & DIY
title: Chippendale's Style Empire
description: A micro-lesson that makes Chippendale's Style Empire usable.

hook.text: Thomas Chippendale never built most 'Chippendale' furniture. He published a catalog and other craftsmen copied it.

buildup.text: His 1754 book, The Gentleman and Cabinet-Maker's Director, contained 160 engraved designs anyone could reproduce.

discovery.text: Chippendale mixed Gothic, Chinese, and Rococo styles into something newâ€”elegant but practical for English homes.

twist.text: The book was an 18th-century IKEA catalog. It democratized stylish furniture beyond London's elite workshops.

climax.text: Today a genuine Chippendale piece commands millions at auction. Copies are in every antique shop on the planet.

quiz.question: How did Thomas Chippendale spread his furniture designs?
options: He published a catalog of engravings other craftsmen could copy
He opened franchise workshops across England
He taught classes at the Royal Academy
